title: Scalar Multiplication
text: Scalar multiplication involves finding the product of a constant by each entry in the matrix. Given $$A=\begin{bmatrix} a_{1,1} & a_{1,2} \\ a_{2,1} & a_{2,2} \end{bmatrix}$$, the scalar multiple $$c A$$ is $$c A=c*\begin{bmatrix} a_{1,1} & a_{1,2} \\ a_{2,1} & a_{2,2} \end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix} c a_{1,1} & c a_{1,2} \\ c a_{2,1} & c a_{2,2} \end{bmatrix}$$

title: Scalar Multiplication
text: Multiply each entry in C by scalar -4. What is the top left entry, $$c_{1,1}$$?

title: Scalar Multiplication
text: What is the bottom left entry, $$c_{2,1}$$, after multiplying by 4?

title: Scalar Multiplication
text: Repeat the same process for each corresponding entries.
